alert.note: Alert for Louisa; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 8:46PM CST until March 08 at 10:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Cedar River near Conesville affecting Muscatine and Louisa Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S affecting Scott and Clinton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cedar River near Conesville. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.2 feet, Water affects Lindle Avenue and Keokuk Avenue, both near Saulsbury Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday afternoon to a crest of 14.2 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.
